devdoc.details: Mock implementation of ERC3525 to expose private mutative functions

contractURI().details: This function SHOULD return the URI for this contract in JSON format, starting with  header `data:application/json;`.  See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3525 for the JSON schema for contract URI.

returns._0: The JSON formatted URI of the current ERC3525 contract

params._index: The index in the slot list

returns._0: The slot at `index` of all slots.

params._index: The index in the token list of the slot
params._slot: The slot to query tokens with

returns._0: The token ID at `_index` of all tokens with `_slot`

params._slot: The slot to query token supply for

returns._0: The total amount of tokens with the specified `_slot`
The number of decimals for value

contractURI().notice: Returns the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the current ERC3525 contract.

slotByIndex(uint256).notice: Get the slot at the specified index of all slots stored by the contract.

slotCount().notice: Get the total amount of slots stored by the contract.

tokenInSlotByIndex(uint256,uint256).notice: Get the token at the specified index of all tokens with the same slot.

tokenSupplyInSlot(uint256).notice: Get the total amount of tokens with the same slot.

valueDecimals().notice: Get the number of decimals the token uses for value - e.g. 6, means the user  representation of the value of a token can be calculated by dividing it by 1,000,000.  Considering the compatibility with third-party wallets, this function is defined as  `valueDecimals()` instead of `decimals()` to avoid conflict with EIP-20 tokens.
